transcript:
in the drawing-room with the visitors who came to congratulate, and who constantly succeeded one another in relays. 
The countess was a woman of about forty- five, with a thin Oriental type of face, evidently worn out with childbearing she had had twelve. A languor of motion and speech, re- sulting from weakness, gave her a distinguished air which inspired respect.
